sources.title: Buster Keaton's "Day Dreams" (1922)
sources.description: This gem is presented by Silent Hall of Fame.   Please visit https://silent-hall-of-fame.org/   to support our non-profit mission and the legacy of silent movie stars by making a tax deductible contribution.   FEEL FREE TO FOLLOW US ON TWITTER @SilentFilmGems   "Day Dreams" is a short comedy, starring Buster Keaton and featuring Joe Roberts, a star of Silent Hall of Fame.  The film again demonstrates Buster Keaton's extraordinary athletic abilities. Directed by               Eddie Cline, Buster Keaton Produced by             Joseph Schenck Scenario by               Eddie Cline, Buster Keaton, Roscoe Arbuckle      Starring                     Buster Keaton, Joe Roberts, Renee Adoree, Joe Keaton Cinematography        Elgin Lessley Distributed by           First National Pictures Inc. Release date               November 1922 Running time             23 min. metadata.Plot: Buster goes away to the city to prove to his girl's father he can succeed. He writes her of his various jobs which she glorifies in her imagination. She sees a surgeon, he is a vet's assistant; she sees him cleaning up on Wall Street, he's really a janitor.
metadata.Writer: Roscoe 'Fatty' Arbuckle, Edward F. Cline, Buster Keaton
